---
title: "Dynamic report"
output: pdf_document
classoption: 
  - landscape
  - a4paper
geometry: 
  - margin=1.5cm
params:
    biologdata: NA
    biologdata_colnames: NA
    provlistas: NA
    provlistas_colnames: NA
header-includes:
  - \usepackage{booktabs}
  - \usepackage{longtable}
  - \usepackage{array}
  - \usepackage{multirow}
  - \usepackage{wrapfig}
  - \usepackage{float}
  - \usepackage{colortbl}
  - \usepackage{pdflscape}
  - \usepackage{tabu}
  - \usepackage{threeparttable}
  - \usepackage{threeparttablex}
  - \usepackage[normalem]{ulem}
  - \usepackage{makecell}
  - \usepackage{xcolor}
---

<!-- https://haozhu233.github.io/kableExtra/awesome_table_in_pdf.pdf -->

```{r, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}
options(knitr.kable.NA = "")
df <- params$biologdata
knitr::kable(df, "latex", col.names = params$biologdata_colnames, linesep = "", booktabs = TRUE, caption = "Biologdata") |>
    kableExtra::kable_styling(latex_options = c("striped", "hold_position", "scale_down"), position = "center") |>
    kableExtra::row_spec(row = 0, angle = 60)
```

\newpage

```{r, echo = FALSE}
knitr::kable(dplyr::bind_cols(params$provlistas), "latex", col.names = unlist(params$provlistas_colnames))
# Add_header_above
```
